context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Brush fire causes destruction around Lemon Grove Trolley Station
context_meta.summary: LEMON GROVE (NEWS 8) — Firefighters were able to quickly put out a brush fire in Lemon Grove Sunday evening, but several homes and part of the trolley infrastructure in the area were damaged in the blaze. Flames damaged power lines, trolley rail ties, a fence and the eaves of some houses, according to Heartland Fire and Rescue. The fire was reported just after 5 p.m. Sunday, according to authorities. It took crews from several agencies nearly an hour to stop the fire from advancing and they continued clean up efforts Sunday night.  The incident was reported as palm trees on fire in the 1500 block of San Altos Place. The fire later jumped Imperial Avenue and was said to be threatening structures

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Officials advise residents of wildfire near Bragg Creek
context_meta.summary: Authorities in Rocky View County are warning the public about a wildfire burning near the community of Bragg Creek and advise them to prepare for possible evacuation. Officials say the fire is in the McLean Creek area and is not posing any threat to Bragg Creek, but residents should stay aware of the situation in case circumstances change. Those living in the area should also be on standby to leave the area if necessary. On Sunday afternoon, Alberta Emergency Alerts issued a bulletin about the wildfire, saying that it is listed as out-of-control and is approximately 100 hectares in size. Voluntary evacuation orders have been put in place for areas west of Highway 762 between Highway 22 and 178

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Crew of 27 Nova Scotians dispatched to help fight Alberta forest fires
context_meta.summary: HALIFAX -- A crew of 27 people from Nova Scotia's Department of Natural Resources was in Alberta Sunday to help control wildfires sweeping across parts of the province. A spokesman with the department said the crew arrived in Edmonton Saturday evening and will remain in Alberta for two weeks. He says the crew of wildfire fighters will be assigned to a line of fire by Alberta officials and will work to keep that line from spreading. The Canadian Interagency Forest Fire Centre requested Nova Scotia's assistance to help control and extinguish the fires. Nova Scotia is a member of the Canadian Mutual Aid Resource Sharing agreement, which ensures all provinces and territories will recieve help if

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Large wildfires break out in Highlands
context_meta.summary: Firefighters have been tackling three large wildfires which have broken out in different areas of the Highlands. About 30 fire service personnel were trying to contain a heath fire near Sligachan on the Isle of Skye. Six appliances were called to the scene shortly before 10:00. Up to 10 acres of land are thought to have been affected. Efforts were also under way to tackle a wildfire which was reported in the Strathcarron area shortly after 14:00. The Scottish Fire and Rescue Service were also alerted to a major blaze at Upper Diabaig, Torridon, at about 10:00. A helicopter was called in to waterbomb that fire, a service spokeswoman said. Four appliances were at the scene, where firefighters were

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Crews battle house fire on Kildare Road
context_meta.summary: All residents made it out of a house fire on Kildare Road. Windsor firefighters were called to the blaze at 759 Kildare on Wednesday afternoon. The fire was fully involved upon arrival, with flames coming through the roof. Fire officials say there was heavy smoke on the second and third floor of the house. Crews were able to get it under control. No word yet on cause or damage.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Brush fire in Burbank prompts closure of some city streets
context_meta.summary: BURBANK (FOX 11 / CNS) - A brush fire broke out on a hillside in Burbank Friday afternoon, prompting the closure of some residential streets and recreational areas while firefighters worked to extinguish the flames, which were visible for miles. The fire was reported around 1 p.m. at Sunset Canyon Drive and Harvard Road and flames were in the vicinity of homes, but no structural losses had been reported as of 2:20 p.m. Roadways and recreation areas were closed above Sunset Canyon Drive, a portion of which was also closed, police said.

context_meta.title: Editorial: Getting a jump on the next big fire season
context_meta.summary: These reports are good news. Green strips may not be an environmentalist's idea of properly managing public lands but they are fully welcomed by local residents, including wildlife. As wildlife biologist Kelly Michelsen described the 10-year plan to Elko residents, “It will protect working landscapes for people that depend on them for their livelihood, and they should protect and enhance the habitat for over 350 wildlife species.” Avoid driving your vehicle onto dry grass or brush. Hot exhaust pipes and mufflers can start fires that you won't even see until it's too late. Avoid target shooting into rocks or metal objects, and place targets in areas free of vegetation. context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Grass fire exinguished near Tuscany, cause of blaze under investigation
context_meta.summary: The efforts of members of the Calgary Fire Department brought a grass fire under control in the city's northwest on Thursday evening. CFD officials confirm firefighters responded to the scene at approximately 6:00 p.m. and the fire was located in an area behind the homes on Tuscarora Way Northwest, near to the Stoney Trail and Crowchild Trail interchange. “Upon our arrival, we saw a fair amount of smoke in the trees here.," said onduty Battalion Chief Harly Spate. "We ordered up three bush buggies, a tender and one engine." Spate says the poplar fluff in the treed area and along the grass acted as an accelerant. “Crews got on it fairly quickly. For sure they had an issue with the fluff inside

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Lawsuit seeks millions in damages and class-action relief for Gatlinburg fire victims
context_meta.summary: A federal lawsuit seeks more than $15 million in damages from the Great Smoky Mountains National Park for the deadly 2016 Gatlinburg wildfire. The lawsuit, filed Thursday in U.S. District Court in Knoxville, names Michael Reed, who lost his wife and two daughters to the fire, along with James England, who lost his home on Greystone Heights Road, as lead plaintiffs and seeks class-action status for all victims of the deadly 2016 Gatlinburg wildfire. Attorney Sidney Gilreath said he expects the number of claims could top 300 people. The park's fire management officer, Greg Salansky, and "park senior leadership were not only unprepared but unqualified to manage the fire," failed to notify Gatlinburg firefighters and police in time, and bear direct responsibility for the 14 deaths and more than $1 billion in property damage caused by the Nov. 28, 2016, fire, Gilreath wrote in the lawsuit.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Forest fire spreads to agricultural fields, six girls receive burns
context_meta.summary: Sixteen-year-old Shivani of Pattra village in Uttarkashi district did not know that her routine walk to home after school would give her scars for a lifetime. Caught in a fire, which spread from forests to agricultural fields, she, along with five other students of her class, received serious burn injuries. The students of Malna Government Girls' Inter College were returning home from school, about 2-3 km away, on Wednesday afternoon. They took the usual shortcut route through the agricultural fields that were burning because of the forest fire spread. Initially ignorant of the fire, the girls entered the fields. Later, they spotted the fire, but planned to move quickly through it thinking they

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: B.C. firefighters tackling new wildfires near Kamloops and Lillooet
context_meta.summary: VANCOUVER - Firefighters in British Columbia have been called out to deal with a pair of new wildfires. The BC Wildfire Service says crews and aircraft are tackling a wildfire measuring about 50 hectares about 55 kilometres northwest of Kamloops and producing smoke that is visible in several communities in the region. This fire is near the perimeter of the Elephant Hill fire - one of the largest in the province in 2017 which burned nearly 2,000 square kilometres of forest, brush and buildings. Another fire measuring about 25 hectares is burning about 35 kilometres west of Lillooet near Xusum Creek.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Vaishno Devi yatra suspended due to forest fire, 25,000 pilgrims stuck
context_meta.summary: JAMMU: At least 25,000 pilgrims to Vaishno Devi shrine were stranded at Katra in Jammu's Reasi district after a massive forest fire broke out in Trikuta hills. Authorities have suspended the pilgrimage from one of the two tracks that lead to the hill shrine. An official of Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board said that the new “battery car track” route was cordoned off and rescue operations were started to evacuate stranded pilgrims. Visitors, however, can still use the old track to visit the shrine. “Around 20,000 devotees from across India are stranded in Katra due to closure of registration counter to avoid rush on the old track in view of the forest fire. At least 2500-3000 pilgrims are also

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Crews battling 'out of control' wildfire west of Cochrane
context_meta.summary: Aerial and ground crews are battling a fire that, according to Alberta Wildfire, currently covers approximately 15 hectares of land on the Stoney Nakoda First Nation. As of 4:45 p.m., provincial officials declared the wildfire as 'out of control'. At that time, the fire was estimated to cover one hectare. The fire is located southwest of Cochrane's West Terrace neighbourhood and across the Bow River. Residents say multiple helicopters and a plane have responded to the area and are dumping water on the fire. The province says that the wildfire is approximately 15 hectares in size and is about one kilometre from the Town of Cochrane near the Bow River. At this time, no properties are being threatened.

context_meta.title: Teen must pay nearly $37M for starting Oregon wildfire, judge rules
context_meta.summary: A judge has ruled that a 15-year-old Washington state boy responsible for starting a major wildfire must pay nearly $37 million. For more on the story here is Zachary Devita.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Living on the Edge: Wildfires Pose a Growing Risk to Homes Built Near Wilderness Areas
context_meta.summary: The horrific Tubbs Fire in California's Sonoma and Napa counties last October tore through more than 36,000 acres, killing 22 people and destroying nearly 6,000 buildings. It was the most destructive wildfire in the state's history in terms of structures lost, according to the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection. Half a century earlier the Hanley Fire burned some 53,000 acres along a nearly identical path. Although that blaze remains Sonoma County's largest on record, it destroyed only a few dozen structures, most of which were homes. The main difference between then and now is the expansion of what researchers call the wildland-urban interface, or WUI: the area where houses

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Firefighters Contain Brush Fire In American Canyon
context_meta.summary: AMERICAN CANYON (CBS SF) — Firefighters have contained a 3- to 5-acre grass and oak woodland fire in American Canyon Monday afternoon, a Cal Fire captain said. The fire in east American Canyon off American Canyon Road was reported around noon, Capt. Leah Simmons-Davis said. It was burning near houses on Via Bellagio, and American Canyon Road was closed between Flosden Road and Interstate Highway 80, Simmons-Davis said. None of the homes were evacuated. The American Canyon Fire Protection District and the Napa County Fire Department also responded to the fire. The cause is under investigation. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Large fire on Arthur's Seat
context_meta.summary: A large grass fire has broken out near the summit of Arthur's Seat in Edinburgh. About 30 firefighters were tackling the blaze on the landmark. It came as fire chiefs issued a wildfire warning following a spate of fires across Scotland in recent days.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Wildfire risks are high again this year – here's what travelers need to know
context_meta.summary: This year the American Automobile Association projects that more than 41.5 million Americans will hit the road over Memorial Day weekend, nearly 5 percent more than last year and the most in a dozen years. The group also recommends packing a mobile phone and car charger, a flashlight with extra batteries, a first-aid kit, a basic toolkit, and drinking water and snacks for all passengers. As coordinator of Colorado State University's Veterinary Extension programs, I help people in rural and urban communities manage all kinds of threats that can affect them and their animals, from disease to disasters. When people travel in unfamiliar places, far from their social safety nets, they should know what challenging conditions exist and prepare appropriately.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Forecasters predict fiery summer, hope for monsoons
context_meta.summary: Predictors such as climate cycles, fuel levels and weather forecasts combine to show that Elko County and surrounding areas could experience an above-normal wildland fire season, according to the National Interagency Fire Center based in Idaho. Matt Murphy from the Elko District Bureau of Land Management presented a pre-season fire outlook to the Elko County Board of Commissioners on May 16.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Gorge trails reopen as summer approaches; many still closed after wildfire
context_meta.summary: Break out your boots, Columbia gorge hikers. Authorities have reopened several trails and lakes in the Columbia River Gorge and Mt. Hood National Forest that have been closed for months because of a massive wildfire. Been yearning to test yourself on the challenging Mt. Defiance Trail? Do it. Ready to tackle the difficult Starvation Ridge Trail? It's all yours. Longing for a day at Wahtum Lake? Go, go, go. Just don't think you'll be the only one taking advantage of the newly-opened destinations. And don't head out the door thinking you can show up at any gorge trailhead: Many are still closed in the aftermath of the nearly 49,000-acre Eagle Creek fire, which swept through the treasured area last

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: As wildfire danger looms, Arizona forest lands start closing
context_meta.summary: PHOENIX (AP) — Tourists and the residents of Arizona mountain towns that rely on them won't have access to parts of some national forests this summer as authorities attempt to prevent wildfires during a critically dangerous time. Apache-Sitgreaves National Forests announced Wednesday that some areas will be closed to the public, although officials haven't yet decided which ones. That's after the Kaibab National Forest on May 11 announced the closure of about 23.4 square miles (6,070 hectares) centered on Bill Williams Mountain near Williams. That closure is intended to protect the watershed for Williams, a northern Arizona city that's a jumping-off point for many visitors to Grand Canyon National
